text: <@U1MG5M6J2>  - it won't work.  I'm also pretty sure that we've never tried using Java chaincode with the BMX services.   There's a few PRs on Fabric around adding TLS support to Java chaincode but they have not been merged last I checked

attachments.fallback: [January 20th, 2017 11:31 AM] andrew_tharp: Does anyone have insight into whether Java chaincode currently works with a Blockchain network running Hyperledger Fabric V0.6.1 if security is enabled for the network?  There is a dWAnswers question where someone is experiencing errors with Java chaincode when security is enabled (<https://developer.ibm.com/answers/questions/342814/java-secured-support-on-bluemix-blockchain/>).  There was a Stack Overflow post from last September that indicated Java chaincode didn't work with security enabled (<http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39403727/hyperledger-fabric-java-chaincode-error>).  Is that still the case?
attachments.text: Does anyone have insight into whether Java chaincode currently works with a Blockchain network running Hyperledger Fabric V0.6.1 if security is enabled for the network?  There is a dWAnswers question where someone is experiencing errors with Java chaincode when security is enabled (<https://developer.ibm.com/answers/questions/342814/java-secured-support-on-bluemix-blockchain/>). text: <@U2Y2V95D2> in v0.6 you'd have to write the logic yourself, e.g. store the value of a key as an array that keeps history, but I doubt it's worth your while.   The underlying architecture of v1.0 is a for all intents and purposes a rewrite of v0.6 but the difficulty required to migrate v0.6-compatible chaincode to v1.0-compatible chaincode is being advertised as minimal.
When upgrading a chaincode in v1, is the world state kept intact?
